About Section

About the Treasury

Our mission at the office of the State Treasurer is to prudently manage and safeguard the Commonwealth's public deposits and investments through sound business practices for the exclusive benefits of our citizens, and preform these duties with integrity, excellence, and leadership.

Read more and the Treasury

Deborah B. Goldberg

Treasurer & Receiver General

The Details

Page Contents

Overview Fees Eligibility Get it Done Forms Additonal Information

Overview

$12 standard fee for residents

The Annual MassParks Pass allows you free parking for one vehicle, during daytime hours, at all State Parks except Quabbin Reservoir. Its valid for one calendar year, from January through December, so youll need to buy a new one each year.

The parking pass costs $60 for Massachusetts residents and $85 dollars for non-Massachusetts residents. If you have two cars, you can pay an additional $25 for a second car sticker that will allow you to park either car for free (only one at a time, though!).

If youre a Massachusetts resident 62 years old or older, you can get a special lifetime Senior MassParks Pass for a one-time fee of only $10.

Fees

The parking pass costs $60 for Massachusetts residents and $85 for non-Massachusetts residents. If you have two cars, you can pay an additional $25 for a second car sticker that will allow you to park either car for free (only one at a time, though!).

If you're a Massachusetts resident 62 years old or older, you can get a special lifetime Senior MassParks Pass for a one-time fee of only $10.

Eligibility

Lorem ipsum blah blah (there's no eligibility for state park pass)

Get it Done

In Person at State Parks

Most parks and beaches that charge daily parking fees sell MassParks Passes at their contact stations during their paid parking seasons. Just ask to purchase a MassParks Pass and show your drivers license or proof of residency. Please note: most parks cannot accept credit cards, so youll have to pay with cash or a check.

Online

You can also order a MassParks pass online through Reserve America. There is an additional $2.75 charge to use this online service. Your pass will be mailed to your home within seven days.

Order a MassParks Pass online through Reserve America 

By Phone

By Mail

(only if you're purchasing a Senior MassParks Pass)
Senior MassParks Passes can be purchased by mail by writing to the following address:

DCR MassParks
251 Causeway Street
Boston, MA 02114
Attn: Senior MassParks Pass Coordinator

and including a photocopy of your MA drivers license or other official proof of MA residency and age, and a check for $10 made payable to the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

Callout Message

Rich Text Editor with a Comp Heading

A paragraph (from the Greek paragraphos, 'to write beside' or 'written beside') is a self-contained unit of a discourse in writing dealing with a particular point or idea. A paragraph consists of one or more sentences. Though not required by the syntax of any language, paragraphs are usually an expected part of formal writing, used to organize longer prose.

  1. This is a list item in an ordered list
  2. An ordered list is a list in which the sequence of items is important.
  3. Lists can be nested inside of each other
    1. This is a nested list item
    2. This is another nested list item in an ordered list
  4. This is the last list item

Attleboro District Court 

88 North Main Street
Attleboro, MA 02703 Directions 

The Attleboro District Court is accessible by the Providence/Stoughton line of the MBTA. The courthouse is also accessible by via the Greater Attleboro Taunton Regional Transit Authority (GATRA).

(508) 222-5900

Barnstable District Court 

3195 Main Street
Barnstable, MA 02630 Directions 

The Barnstable District Court is accessible by the Barnstable Villager line of the Cape Cod Regional Transit Authority.

(508) 747-8512

Berkshire County Superior Court 

76 East Street
Pittsfield, MA 01201 Directions 

For public transportation information to the courthouse, visit the Berkshire Regional Transit Authority website or call 800-292-2782.

(413) 499-7487

Brookline District Court 

360 Washington Street
Brookline, MA 02445 Directions 

The Brookline District Court is accessible by the Riverside D- Green Line of the MBTA. The closest stop to the courthouse is the Brookline Village Stop. The courthouse is also accessible by the following bus lines: Bus 60 (Chestnut Hill-Kenmore Station), Bus 65 (Brighton Center-Kenmore via Washington Street) and Bus 66 (Harvard Square-Dudley Station via Allston).

(781) 322-7500

Cambridge District Court 

4040 Mystic Valley Parkway
Medford, MA 02155 Directions 

The Cambridge District Court is accessible by the Orange Line of the MBTA. The closest stop to the courthouse is the Wellington Station Stop. The courthouse is also accessible by the following bus lines: Bus 90, Bus 97, Bus 99, Bus 100, Bus 106, Bus 108, Bus 110, Bus 112 and Bus 134.

(781) 322-7500

Concord District Court 

305 Walden Street
Concord, MA 01742 Directions 

The Concord District Court is accessible by the Fitchburg/South Acton line of the MBTA. The closes stop to the courthouse is the Concord Stop which is about 1.2 miles from the courthouse.

(781) 322-7500

Edgartown District Court 

81 Main Street
Edgartown, MA 02539 Directions 

The Edgartown District Court is accessible by the following routes on the Vineyard Transit Authority: Route 1, Route 6, Route 8 and Route 13.

(781) 322-7500

Lowell District Court 

41 Hurd Street
Lowell, MA 01852 Directions 

The Lowell District Court is also accessible by the Lowell line of the MBTA. The closest stop to the courthouse is Lowell Station which is approximately 1/2 of a mile from the courthouse.

(781) 322-7500

Most parks and beaches that charge daily parking fees sell MassParks Passes at their contact stations during their paid parking seasons. Just ask to purchase a MassParks Pass and show your drivers license or proof of residency. Please note: most parks cannot accept credit cards, so youll have to pay with cash or a check.

If you concentrate really hard, a pass might magically appear in front of you

You can also order a MassParks pass online through Reserve America. There is an additional $2.75 charge to use this online service. Your pass will be mailed to your home within seven days.

Senior MassParks Passes can be purchased by mail by writing to the following address:

DCR MassParks
251 Causeway Street
Boston, MA 02114
Attn: Senior MassParks Pass Coordinator

and including a photocopy of your MA drivers license or other official proof of MA residency and age, and a check for $10 made payable to the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
